snippet: President Obama’s stop in Louisiana took on outsized political overtones in this campaign season.
abstract: President Obama stops in Louisiana to inspect the damage wrought by Hurricane Isaac in a visit that takes on outsized political overtones as the campaign season heats up; trip comes three days after Mitt Romney toured the Louisiana coast after accepting his party's nomination at the Republican National Convention.

byline.contributor: Trip Gabriel contributed reporting from Greenville, N.C.

lead_paragraph: President Obama’s stop in Louisiana took on outsized political overtones in this campaign season.

headline.seo: Obama Detours From Campaign Trail to Inspect Hurricane Isaac’s Damage
headline.main: Obama Makes Detour to Visit Hurricane Site
headline.print_headline: Obama Makes Detour To Visit Hurricane Site
